title: Aussie fintech Verrency in Series B funding pitch
text:
A fintech backed by Caledonia (Private) Investments boss Will Vicars and former The Myer Family Investments Group CEO Peter Hodgson is in front of venture capital funds and other potential investors with a Series B funding round.

Street Talk can reveal Verrency, whose clients include banks and other card issuers in Australia and offshore, is seeking to raise at least $US10 million with the help of New York-based SenaHill Partners and Singapore’s Delta Partners/ SoHoCapital.

Verrency is run by David Link, who was formerly head of Accenture's financial services practice.

Verrency founder David Link will be in front of potential investors next week.

It has a patented software platform that sits on bank and card issuers’ legacy platforms and helps them deliver new products and services to customers such as auto-rounding, real-time budgeting notifications and instant loyalty rewards.

Its clients include banks and card issuers in Australia and offshore including Volt Bank, Colombia’s Banco Davivienda, UAE-based Emirates NBD and a range of others that are undisclosed, including what it says is a top 5 US bank. And it has about 40 third-party partners it connects to the aforementioned banks and issuers, such as Raiz.
description: Fintech Verrency is in front of venture capital funds and other potential investors with a Series B funding round.
